stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on Course 15 “Astro Arcade,” building and testing new pinball-style platform pieces while reflecting on recent Course 3 tester feedback and discussing upcoming demo and memory optimisations.

development_findings.summary: Course 15 is the final main course; three side levels and the overworld still need to be built before release.
development_findings.quote: After this level, we still need three side-levels and the overworlds.

development_findings.summary: New ‘Astro Arcade’ mechanics include rotating flippers, spherical bumpers, triangular direction pads, stand-on metal plates and trampoline pads, all now partially programmed and test-playable.
development_findings.quote: Next we'll be programming all of these.

development_findings.summary: Flipper pieces add upward bias, grant temporary air-control and disable fall damage to keep players alive after launch.
development_findings.quote: We definitely need to give the player a lot of air control after this so that they can realistically not die.

development_findings.summary: Pinball elements will be scattered beneath the main stage instead of forming a classic table to avoid prior design pitfalls and enable under-stage traversal.
development_findings.quote: If there's one lesson... do not arrange flipper pieces into a pinball machine.

development_findings.summary: Tester video of Course 3 showed players missing the intended path and 8-bit pipe being too easy to access; Kaze plans to hide the pipe initially, soften jumps and add clearer guidance to Star 1.
development_findings.quote: The overall conclusion is the player really needs to be guided to Star 1 a lot more.

development_findings.summary: Visual direction of Course 15 draws from Walrus Pinball lighting, with animated rings and a star on the trampoline pad that will brighten on impact.
development_findings.quote: I need that exact thing in the level… we’ll figure it out.

development_findings.summary: The hack relies on the N64 Expansion Pak, splits memory between three frame-buffers and exploits a hidden ninth address bit to access an extra 1 MB (incompatible with most emulators).
development_findings.quote: We found a way to use an extra one megabyte in the N64, and it doesn't work on emulators.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 exporter applies an unintended 64-unit offset to translated geometry; Kaze currently compensates manually.
development_findings.quote: This fast 64 bug actually makes it so that we can't export the level correctly.

development_findings.summary: Considering re-introducing a bubble safety system for void falls in the space level, similar to earlier stages that rescue players instead of killing them.
development_findings.quote: Maybe it really should [save you] because falling into the skybox is brutal.

development_findings.summary: First public demo will ship with only Course 1 and a temporary Delfino Plaza overworld containing control-explanation signs; testers said the new camera and controls are “great.”
development_findings.quote: We are doing a demo release with just Course 1… everyone that played the demo thought that the new controls and camera were great.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values clear onboarding: he wants the first star path to be obvious so players build a mental map before exploring.
context_findings.quote: That's what we want to do. We want to make it very obvious where to go at first.

context_findings.summary: He prefers games that gain depth from simple rules and even advocates a smaller, move-reduced future Smash title.
context_findings.quote: The beauty in competitive games is to get complex interactions out of simple rules.

context_findings.summary: Ongoing anxiety about Nintendo DMCA action shapes trailer and distribution plans.
context_findings.quote: With the release trailer, I want to be very careful, because I feel like Nintendo is going to try to take that down.

context_findings.summary: Kaze feels overworked, citing ‘a busy week’ and needing to ‘catch up on a hundred hours of work.’
He humorously contemplates click-baiting a Mario 64 Unreal port, then orchestrating his own takedown once the money rolls in.
context_findings.quote: After we get like a million views… we have to make sure we get shut down by Nintendo, because we don't want to finish that project.

biobak.summary: Delivered the temporary Delfino Plaza overworld model for the upcoming demo and received design feedback.
biobak.quote: This is going to be the overworld from the demo.

biobak.summary: Will design the blinking/light pattern for the trampoline star in Course 15.
biobak.quote: I'll just let you decide on how this should blink, and I will implement that.

biobak.summary: Proposed a ‘ball-tube’ platform idea and flagged texel-density and sign-model issues during stream.

badub.summary: Handles music and SFX; Kaze directs OST requests to him and suggests he can supply raw sound files for fans.
badub.quote: You'd have to ask Badub, but I'm sure he's up for it.

zeina.summary: Provided casual visual feedback (‘What ugly thing?’), brought Kaze hot chocolate mid-stream and tended to their baby, illustrating work-life overlap.

key_stories.title: Tester Lost in Course 3
key_stories.summary: A play-tester found only one star, missed the main path and quit. Kaze reviewed the footage and listed design flaws.
key_stories.challenge: Players overlook the intended route and access the difficult 8-bit pipe too early.
key_stories.process: Watched recording, documented issues, analysed Mario 64’s guiding techniques.
key_stories.outcome: Plan to hide the bit pipe initially, simplify jumps and add clearer indicators to guide players to Star 1.
key_stories.key_quote: People find the bit pipe too easily… the player really needs to be guided to Star 1 a lot more.

key_stories.title: Building the Astro Arcade Flipper System
key_stories.summary: Kaze engineered multiple pinball-inspired pieces for Course 15 and tuned their physics and visuals live on stream.
key_stories.challenge: Create fun, controllable pinball mechanics within N64 constraints.
key_stories.process: Modelled assets, wrote collision and momentum code, adjusted normals, added air control and lighting tests.
key_stories.outcome: Functional flipper, bumper and trampoline elements ready for level integration.
key_stories.key_quote: Let's put a bunch of platforms down and program these things, see what happens.

key_stories.title: Unlocking Hidden N64 Memory
key_stories.summary: Kaze explained a new trick that accesses an extra 1 MB by using a hidden ninth address bit.
key_stories.challenge: Overcome N64 memory limits without sacrificing speed.
key_stories.process: Re-mapped frame-buffers, fragmented memory intentionally, prepared explanatory video.
key_stories.outcome: Gained extra RAM (works on hardware but not emulators) and new content for his channel.
key_stories.key_quote: We found a way to use an extra one megabyte in the N64, and it doesn't work on emulators.

key_stories.title: Prototype Demo Overworld
key_stories.summary: Need an overworld for the limited demo that ships with Course 1.
key_stories.challenge: Create a placeholder hub quickly that still teaches new controls.
key_stories.process: Biobak modelled a Delfino Plaza-style area; Kaze reviewed lighting and planned instructional signs.
key_stories.outcome: Model accepted for demo build; signs will explain camera and options.
key_stories.key_quote: We are doing a demo release with just Course 1 and it's going to have the Delfino Plaza in it.
